identificationModule.briefTitle: Bioequivalence Study of the Fixed Dose Combination of 5 mg Saxagliptin and 500 mg Metformin XR Tablet (Manufactured in Mt Vernon, IN) Relative to 5 mg Saxagliptin Tablet and 500 mg Metformin XR Tablet (Manufactured in Evansville, IN)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Bioequivalence Study of the Fixed Dose Combination of 5 mg Saxagliptin and 500 mg Metformin XR Tablet (Manufactured in Mt Vernon, IN) Relative to 5 mg Saxagliptin Tablet and 500 mg Metformin XR Tablet (Manufactured in Evansville, IN) Coadministered to Healthy Subjects in a Fed Condition

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate bioequivalence (BE) of a 5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin extended release (XR) fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet (manufactured in Mt Vernon, Indiana \[IN\]) to coadministered 5 mg saxagliptin and 500 mg metformin XR tablet (manufactured in Evansville, IN) in fed healthy subjects.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This study is designed to evaluate if the FDC tablet of 5 mg saxagliptin/500 mg metformin extended release (manufactured in Mt Vernon, Indiana) is bioequivalent to the coadministered 5 mg saxagliptin and 500 mg metformin XR tablet (manufactured in Evansville, Indiana)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Saxagliptin Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time 0 Extrapolated to Infinity (AUC[0-inf])
primaryOutcomes.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 extrapolated to infinity; calculated as AUC0-t \[calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule\] + Ct/Kel, where Ct was the last measurable concentration and Kel was the terminal rate constant
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Periods 1, 2, and 3 (samples taken before dosing, and at 0.167, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12, 18, 24, 36 and 48 hours after dosing)

Safety: Adverse Events (AEs), Discontinuations Due to AEs, Deaths, and Serious AEs (SAEs)
secondaryOutcomes.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs inpatient hospitalization (including elective surgery), results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or is an important medical event.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: AEs: from initiation of study drug administration on Day 1/Period 1 through study discharge Day 3/Period 3. SAEs: from date of written consent until 30 days after discontinuation of dosing or participation in study if last scheduled visit occurred later.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Safety: Clinically Significant Laboratory, Vital Sign, Physical Examination, and Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
secondaryOutcomes.description: Abnormalities considered by the investigator to be clinically significant and/or reported as an AE.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From Day 1 of Period 1 through Day 3 of Period 3 (study discharge)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Healthy male and female subjects as determined by no clinically significant deviation from normal in medical history, physical examination, electrocardiogram (ECG), and clinical laboratory determinations
* Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18 to 32 kg/m2, inclusive
* Ages 18 to 45, inclusive

Exclusion Criteria:

* Evidence of organ dysfunction or any clinically significant deviation from normal in physical examination, vital signs, ECG or clinical laboratory determinations beyond what is consistent with the target population
* Major surgical procedure within 4 weeks prior to randomization
* Positive serology test for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis B virus (HBV) or hepatitis C virus (HCV)
* Clinically significant history or presence of any of the following conditions: heart, liver, or kidney disease, neurologic or psychiatric disease
* History of gastrointestinal disease within the past 3 months
* Any clinically significant medical condition that could potentially affect your participation in the study and/or personal well-being, as judged by the investigator
* Donated blood or blood products to a blood bank, blood transfusion or participated in a clinical study (except a screening visit) requiring withdrawal of blood within 4 weeks prior to randomization
* Unable to tolerate oral and/or intravenous (IV) medications
* Unable to tolerate the puncturing of veins for drawing of blood
* Known allergy or hypersensitivity to any component of the study medication
* History of any significant drug allergies (such as anaphylaxis or hepatotoxicity)
* Used any prescription drugs or over the counter products to control acid (for example, Prevacid, Mylanta or Rolaids) within 4 weeks prior to randomization
* Used any other drugs including over the counter medications and herbal preparations within 1 week prior to randomization
* Taken any investigational drug or placebo (inactive drug) within 4 weeks prior to randomization

references.citation: Boulton DW, Smith CH, Li L, Huang J, Tang A, LaCreta FP. Bioequivalence of saxagliptin/metformin extended-release (XR) fixed-dose combination tablets and single-component saxagliptin and metformin XR tablets in healthy adult subjects. Clin Drug Investig. 2011;31(9):619-30. doi: 10.2165/11590290-000000000-00000.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Participants underwent screening evaluations to determine eligibility within 21 days before dosing, and were admitted to the clinical facility the evening before dosing (Day -1). On Day 1 of Period 1, a total of 30 participants who met all of the inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria were randomly assigned to 1 of 6 treatment sequences.

groups.title: Treatment Sequence ABC
groups.description: Treatment A (period 1): 5 mg saxagliptin + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet; Treatment B (period 2): fixed-dose combination (FDC) Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fed conditions; Treatment C (period 3): FDC Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fasting conditions. Participants underwent at least a 3-day washout period between each treatment.

groups.title: Treatment Sequence ACB
groups.description: Treatment A (period 1): 5 mg saxagliptin + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet; Treatment C (period 2): FDC Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fasting conditions; Treatment B (period 3): fixed-dose combination (FDC) Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fed conditions. Participants underwent at least a 3-day washout period between each treatment.

groups.title: Treatment Sequence BAC
groups.description: Treatment B (period 1): fixed-dose combination (FDC) Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fed conditions; Treatment A (period 2): 5 mg saxagliptin + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet; Treatment C (period 3): FDC Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fasting conditions. Participants underwent at least a 3-day washout period between each treatment.

groups.title: Treatment Sequence BCA
groups.description: Treatment B (period 1): fixed-dose combination (FDC) Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fed conditions; Treatment C (period 2): FDC Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fasting conditions; Treatment A (period 3): 5 mg saxagliptin + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet. Participants underwent at least a 3-day washout period between each treatment.

groups.title: Treatment Sequence CAB
groups.description: Treatment C (period 1): FDC Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fasting conditions; Treatment A (period 2): 5 mg saxagliptin + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet; Treatment B (period 3): fixed-dose combination (FDC) Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fed conditions. Participants underwent at least a 3-day washout period between each treatment.

groups.title: Treatment Sequence CBA
groups.description: Treatment C (period 1): FDC Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fasting conditions; Treatment B (period 2): fixed-dose combination (FDC) Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fed conditions; Treatment A (period 3): 5 mg saxagliptin + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet. Participants underwent at least a 3-day washout period between each treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Saxagliptin Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time 0 Extrapolated to Infinity (AUC[0-inf])
outcomeMeasures.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 extrapolated to infinity; calculated as AUC0-t \[calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule\] + Ct/Kel, where Ct was the last measurable concentration and Kel was the terminal rate constant
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Periods 1, 2, and 3 (samples taken before dosing, and at 0.167, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12, 18, 24, 36 and 48 hours after dosing)

groups.title: Treatment A - Saxagliptin + Metformin XR, Fed
groups.description: 5 mg saxagliptin tablet + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet under fed conditions

groups.title: Treatment B - FDC Tablet (Saxagliptin + Metformin XR), Fed
groups.description: fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fed conditions

groups.title: Treatment C - FDC Tablet (Saxagliptin + Metformin XR), Fasting
groups.description: FDC Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fasting conditions

analyses.groupDescription: If there was no difference between the bioavailabilities of saxagliptin from the FDC tablet versus saxagliptin from coadministration of a saxagliptin tablet and a metformin XR tablet under fed conditions, then 24 subjects would have provided 99% power to conclude bioequivalence (BE) with respect to Cmax and AUC0-inf. If there was a 5% difference, then 24 subjects would have provided 94% and 99% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax and AUC0-inf, respectively.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: BE was concluded if the 90% CIs for the test-to-reference ratios of geometric means were entirely contained within 0.800 to 1.250 for both Cmax and AUC0-inf of saxagliptin
analyses.paramType: Ratio of Geometric Least Squares Means
analyses.estimateComment: Ratio=Treatment B/Treatment A. Geometric least squares means values are presented in other statistical analysis entries.

analyses.nonInferiorityComment: Lack of food effect was concluded if the 90% CIs for the test-to-reference ratios of geometric means were entirely contained within (80%, 125%) for both Cmax and AUC(INF) of saxagliptin and metformin.
analyses.estimateComment: Ratio=Treatment B/Treatment C. Geometric least squares means values are presented in other statistical analysis entries.

analyses.groupDescription: Geometric least squares means for treatment A
Geometric least squares means for treatment B
Geometric least squares mean for treatment C

outcomeMeasures.title: Metformin AUC(0-inf)
outcomeMeasures.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 extrapolated to infinity; calculated as AUC0-t \[calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule\] + Ct/Kel, where Ct was the last measurable concentration and Kel was the terminal rate constant
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Treated participants (the smaller sample size for AUC\[0-inf\] was due to the inability to estimate potassium chloride for some participants)
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Periods 1, 2, and 3 (samples taken before dosing, and at 0.167, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12, 18, 24, 36 and 48 hours after dosing)

groups.title: Treatment A - Saxagliptin + Metformin XR, Fed
groups.description: 5 mg saxagliptin tablet + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet under fed conditions

groups.title: Treatment B - FDC Tablet (Saxagliptin + Metformin XR), Fed
groups.description: fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fed conditions

groups.title: Treatment C - FDC Tablet (Saxagliptin + Metformin XR), Fasting
groups.description: FDC Tablet (5 mg Saxagliptin + 500 mg Metformin XR) under fasting conditions

analyses.groupDescription: If there was no difference between the bioavailabilities of metformin from the FDC tablet versus metformin from coadministration of a saxagliptin tablet and a metformin XR tablet under fed conditions, then 24 subjects would have provided 99% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax and AUC0-inf. If there was a 5% difference, then 24 subjects would have provided 96% and 97% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax and AUC0-inf, respectively.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: BE concluded if the 90% CIs for the test-to-reference ratios of geometric means were entirely contained within (80%, 125%) for both Cmax and AUC(INF) of saxagliptin and metformin.
analyses.paramType: Ratio of Least Squares Geometric Means
analyses.estimateComment: Ratio = Treatment B/Treatment A. Geometric least squares means values are presented in other statistical analysis entries.

analyses.nonInferiorityComment: lack of food effect concluded if the 90% CIs for the test-to-reference ratios of geometric means were entirely contained within (80%, 125%) for both Cmax and AUC(INF) of saxagliptin and metformin.
analyses.paramType: Ratio of Geometric LS Mean and 90% CI
analyses.estimateComment: Ratio = Treatment B/Treatment C. Geometric least squares means values are presented in other statistical analysis entries.

analyses.groupDescription: Geometric least squares means for treatment A
Geometric least squares mean for treatment B
Geometric least squares mean for treatment C

outcomeMeasures.title: Metformin AUC(0-t)
outcomeMeasures.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 to the time of the last quantifiable concentration (Ct), calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Period 1 (samples taken before dosing, and at 0.167,0.25,0.5,0.75,1,1.5,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,10,12,18,24,36 and 48 hours after dosing)

outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Periods 1, 2, and 3 (samples taken before dosing, and at 0.167, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12, 18, 24, 36 and 48 hours after dosing)

groups.title: Treatment A - Saxagliptin + Metformin XR, Fed
groups.description: 5 mg saxagliptin tablet + a single 500 mg metformin XR tablet under fed conditions

analyses.groupDescription: If there was no difference between the bioavailabilities of metformin from the FDC tablet versus metformin from coadministration of a metformin XR tablet under fed conditions, then 24 subjects would have provided 99% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax and AUC0-inf. If there was a 5% difference, then 24 subjects would have provided 96% and 97% power to conclude BE with respect to Cmax and AUC0-inf, respectively.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment: BE was concluded if the 90% CIs for the test-to-reference ratios of geometric means were entirely contained within 0.800 to 1.250 for both Cmax and AUC0-inf of metformin.
analyses.paramType: Ratio of Geometric Least Squares Means
analyses.estimateComment: Ratio = Treatment B/Treatment A. Geometric least squares means values are presented in other statistical analysis entries.

analyses.nonInferiorityComment: Lack of food effect was concluded if the 90% CIs for the test-to-reference ratios of geometric means were entirely contained within (80%, 125%) for both Cmax and AUC(inf) of saxagliptin and metformin.
analyses.paramType: Ratio of Geometric Least Squares Means
analyses.estimateComment: Ration = Treatment B/Treatment C. Geometric least squares means values are presented in other statistical analysis entries.

outcomeMeasures.title: Metformin T1/2
outcomeMeasures.description: terminal half life; calculated as ln(2)/Kel
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Treated participants (the smaller sample size for T1/2 was due to the inability to estimate Kel for some of the subjects).

outcomeMeasures.title: Safety: Adverse Events (AEs), Discontinuations Due to AEs, Deaths, and Serious AEs (SAEs)
outcomeMeasures.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs inpatient hospitalization (including elective surgery), results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or is an important medical event.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Safety Population = all participants who received any study drug.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: AEs: from initiation of study drug administration on Day 1/Period 1 through study discharge Day 3/Period 3. SAEs: from date of written consent until 30 days after discontinuation of dosing or participation in study if last scheduled visit occurred later.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.

ancestors.term: Hormones, Hormone Substitutes, and Hormone Antagonists
